snippet: Opponents of China’s “re-education through labor” system say new leadership could put an end to abuses at the labor camps, which confine perceived troublemakers without trial.
abstract: China's vast system of forced-labor penal colonies is facing a groundswell of opposition from both inside and outside the Communist party; critics say that country's recent leadership transition has created potential opening for judicial and legal reform of system, which holds as many as 190,000 inmates at any one time.
lead_paragraph: Opponents of China’s “re-education through labor” system say new leadership could put an end to abuses at the labor camps, which confine perceived troublemakers without trial.
